papers.title: Otter: A Multi-Modal Model with In-Context Instruction Tuning
papers.authors: Bo Li,Yuanhan Zhang,Liangyu Chen,Jinghao Wang,Jingkang Yang,Ziwei Liu
papers.summary: Otter, a multi-modal model based on OpenFlamingo (open-sourced version of DeepMind's Flamingo), trained on MIMIC-IT and showcasing improved instruction-following ability and in-context learning is introduced.

papers.title: PathAsst: Redefining Pathology through Generative Foundation AI Assistant for Pathology
papers.authors: Yuxuan Sun,Chenglu Zhu,S. Zheng,Kai Zhang,Zhongyi Shui,Xiaoxuan Yu,Yi-Lei Zhao,Honglin Li,Yunlong Zhang,Ruojia Zhao,Xinheng Lyu,Lin Yang
papers.summary: The PathAsst is presented, which is a generative foundation AI assistant to revolutionize diagnostic and predictive analytics in pathology, trained based on Vicuna-13B language model in coordination with the CLIP vision encoder.

papers.title: LLaMA-Adapter V2: Parameter-Efficient Visual Instruction Model
papers.authors: Peng Gao,Jiaming Han,Renrui Zhang,Ziyi Lin,Shijie Geng,Aojun Zhou,W. Zhang,Pan Lu,Conghui He,Xiangyu Yue,Hongsheng Li,Y. Qiao
papers.summary: This work augments LLaMA-Adapter by unlocking more learnable parameters and proposes an early fusion strategy to feed visual tokens only into the early LLM layers, contributing to better visual knowledge incorporation and achieves strong multi-modal reasoning with only a small-scale image-text and instruction dataset.

papers.title: IdealGPT: Iteratively Decomposing Vision and Language Reasoning via Large Language Models
papers.authors: Haoxuan You,Ruijun Sun,Zhecan Wang,Long Chen,Gengyu Wang,Hammad A. Ayyubi,Kai-Wei Chang,Shih-Fu Chang
papers.summary: The IdealGPT framework is presented, a framework that iteratively decomposes VL reasoning using large language models (LLMs) and outperforms the best existing GPT-4-like models by an absolute 10% on VCR and 15% on SNLI-VE.

papers.title: LAMM: Language-Assisted Multi-Modal Instruction-Tuning Dataset, Framework, and Benchmark
papers.authors: Zhen-fei Yin,Jiong Wang,Jianjian Cao,Zhelun Shi,Dingning Liu,Mukai Li,Lu Sheng,Lei Bai,Xiaoshui Huang,Zhiyong Wang,Wanli Ouyang,Jing Shao
papers.summary: This work extends the research of MLLMs to point clouds and presents the LAMM-Dataset and LAMm-Benchmark for 2D image and 3D point cloud understanding and establishes an extensible framework to facilitate the extension of M LLMs to additional modalities.

papers.title: Video ChatCaptioner: Towards Enriched Spatiotemporal Descriptions
papers.authors: Jun Chen,Deyao Zhu,Kilichbek Haydarov,Xiang Li,Mohamed Elhoseiny
papers.summary: This work introduces Video ChatCaptioner, an innovative approach for creating more comprehensive spatiotemporal video descriptions, specifically designed to select frames for posing video content-driven questions and shows promise as a method for enhancing video content.

papers.title: LMEye: An Interactive Perception Network for Large Language Models
papers.authors: Yunxin Li,Baotian Hu,Xinyu Chen,Lin Ma,M. Zhang
papers.summary: Interactive Perception Network (IPN), aiming to achieve a LVLM by incorporating the image understanding capability into Large Language Models (LLMs), significantly improves the zero-shot performance of LVLMs on various multimodal tasks compared to previous methods.

papers.title: VisionLLM: Large Language Model is also an Open-Ended Decoder for Vision-Centric Tasks
papers.authors: Wen Wang,Zhe Chen,Xiaokang Chen,Jiannan Wu,Xizhou Zhu,Gang Zeng,Ping Luo,Tong Lu,Jie Zhou,Y. Qiao,Jifeng Dai
papers.summary: This work presents an LLM-based framework for vision-centric tasks, termed VisionLLM, which provides a unified perspective for vision and language tasks by treating images as a foreign language and aligning vision-focused tasks with language tasks that can be flexibly defined and managed using language instructions.

papers.title: ChatCAD+: Towards a Universal and Reliable Interactive CAD using LLMs
papers.authors: Zihao Zhao,Sheng Wang,Jinchen Gu,Yitao Zhu,Lanzhuju Mei,Zixu Zhuang,Zhiming Cui,Qian Wang,Dinggang Shen
papers.summary: ChatCAD+ is presented, an interactive CAD system that is universal, reliable, and capable of handling medical images from diverse domains and incorporates a template retrieval system that emulates real-world diagnostic reporting, thereby improving its seamless integration into existing clinical workflows.

papers.title: BiomedGPT: A Unified and Generalist Biomedical Generative Pre-trained Transformer for Vision, Language, and Multimodal Tasks
papers.authors: Kaiyuan Zhang,Jun Yu,Zhilin Yan,Yixin Liu,Eashan Adhikarla,S. Fu,Xun Chen,Chen Chen,Yuyin Zhou,Xiang Li,Lifang He,B. Davison,Quanzheng Li,Yong Chen,Hongfang Liu,Lichao Sun
papers.summary: A unified and generalist Biomedical Generative Pre-trained Transformer model, which leverages self-supervision on large and diverse datasets to accept multi-modal inputs and perform a range of downstream tasks, with far-reaching implications for improving healthcare outcomes.

papers.title: mPLUG-Owl: Modularization Empowers Large Language Models with Multimodality
papers.authors: Qinghao Ye,Haiyang Xu,Guohai Xu,Jiabo Ye,Ming Yan,Yi Zhou,Junyan Wang,Anwen Hu,Pengcheng Shi,Yaya Shi,Chenliang Li,Yuanhong Xu,Hehong Chen,Junfeng Tian,Qiang Qi,J. Zhang,Feiyan Huang

papers.title: InternGPT: Solving Vision-Centric Tasks by Interacting with Chatbots Beyond Language
papers.authors: Zhaoyang Liu,Yinan He,Wenhai Wang,Weiyun Wang,Yi Wang,Shoufa Chen,Qing-Long Zhang,Yang Yang,Qingyun Li,Jiashuo Yu,Kunchang Li,Zhe Chen,Xuecheng Yang,Xizhou Zhu,Yali Wang,Limin Wang,Ping Luo,Jifeng Dai,Yu Qiao
papers.summary: By incorporating pointing instructions, the proposed iGPT significantly improves the efficiency of communication between users and chatbots, as well as the accuracy of chatbots in vision-centric tasks, especially in complicated visual scenarios where the number of objects is greater than 2.

papers.title: VideoChat: Chat-Centric Video Understanding
papers.authors: Kunchang Li,Yinan He,Yi Wang,Yizhuo Li,Wen Wang,Ping Luo,Yali Wang,Limin Wang,Yu Qiao
papers.summary: VideoChat is introduced, an end-to-end chat-centric video understanding system that integrates video foundation models and large language models via a learnable neural interface, excelling in spatiotemporal reasoning, event localization, and causal relationship inference.

papers.title: Visual Programming for Text-to-Image Generation and Evaluation
papers.authors: Jaemin Cho,Abhaysinh Zala,Mohit Bansal
papers.summary: This work proposes two novel interpretable/explainable visual programming frameworks for text-to-image (T2I) generation and evaluation and introduces VPEval, an interpretable and explainable evaluation framework for T2I generation based on visual programming.

papers.title: ECHo: Event Causality Inference via Human-centric Reasoning
papers.authors: Yuxi Xie,Guanzhen Li,MingSung Kan
papers.summary: A unified framework aligned with the Chain-of-Thought (CoT) paradigm is proposed to assess the reasoning capability of current AI systems and scrutinize the advanced large language and multimodal models via three complementary human-centric ECHo tasks.

papers.title: EmbodiedGPT: Vision-Language Pre-Training via Embodied Chain of Thought
papers.authors: Yao Mu,Qinglong Zhang,Mengkang Hu,Wen Wang,Mingyu Ding,Jun Jin,Bin Wang,Jifeng Dai,Y. Qiao,Ping Luo
papers.summary: This work introduces EmbodiedGPT, an end-to-end multi-modal foundation model for embodied AI, empowering embodied agents with multi- modal understanding and execution capabilities, and significantly enhances the success rate of the embodied control task by extracting more effective features.

papers.title: Cheap and Quick: Efficient Vision-Language Instruction Tuning for Large Language Models
papers.authors: Gen Luo,Yiyi Zhou,Tianhe Ren,Shen Chen,Xiaoshuai Sun,Rongrong Ji
papers.summary: A novel and affordable solution for the effective VL adaption of LLMs, called Mixture-of-Modality Adaptation (MMA), which adopts lightweight modules, i.e., adapters, to bridge the gap between LLMs and VL tasks, which also enables the joint optimization of the image and language models

papers.title: On Evaluating Adversarial Robustness of Large Vision-Language Models
papers.authors: Yunqing Zhao,Tianyu Pang,Chao Du,Xiao Yang,Chongxuan Li,Ngai-Man Cheung,Min Lin
papers.summary: Evaluating the robustness of open-source large VLMs in the most realistic and high-risk setting, where adversaries have only black-box system access and seek to deceive the model into returning the targeted responses is proposed.

papers.title: GPT4Tools: Teaching Large Language Model to Use Tools via Self-instruction
papers.authors: Rui Yang,Lin Song,Yanwei Li,Sijie Zhao,Yixiao Ge,Xiu Li,Ying Shan
papers.summary: The GPT4Tools based on self-instruct to enable open-source LLMs, such as LLaMA and OPT, to use tools, generates an instruction-following dataset by prompting an advanced teacher with various multi-modal contexts using the Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) optimization.

papers.title: MIMIC-IT: Multi-Modal In-Context Instruction Tuning
papers.authors: Bo Li,Yuanhan Zhang,Liangyu Chen,Jinghao Wang,Fanyi Pu,Jingkang Yang,C. Li,Ziwei Liu
papers.summary: MultI-Modal In-Context Instruction Tuning (MIMIC-IT), a dataset comprising 2.8 million multimodal instruction-response pairs, with 2.2 million unique instructions derived from images and videos, is presented and a large VLM named Otter is trained.

papers.title: Valley: Video Assistant with Large Language model Enhanced abilitY
papers.authors: Ruipu Luo,Ziwang Zhao,Min Yang,Junwei Dong,Ming-Hui Qiu,Pengcheng Lu,Tao Wang,Zhongyu Wei
papers.summary: The proposed Valley model is designed with a simple projection module that bridges video, image, and language modalities, and is further unified with a multi-lingual LLM, and has the potential to function as a highly effective multilingual video assistant that can make complex video understanding scenarios easy.

papers.title: The Art of SOCRATIC QUESTIONING: Zero-shot Multimodal Reasoning with Recursive Thinking and Self-Questioning
papers.authors: Jingyuan Qi,Zhiyang Xu,Ying Shen,Minqian Liu,Di Jin,Qifan Wang,Lifu Huang
papers.summary: Qualitative analysis clearly demonstrates the intermediate thinking steps elicited by Socratic Questioning are similar to the human's recursively thinking process of a complex reasoning problem.

papers.title: Video-LLaMA: An Instruction-tuned Audio-Visual Language Model for Video Understanding
papers.authors: Han Zhang,Xin Li,Lidong Bing
papers.summary: Video-LLaMA showcases the ability to perceive and comprehend video content, generating meaningful responses that are grounded in the visual and auditory information presented in the videos, highlighting the potential of Video- LLaMA as a promising prototype for audio-visual AI assistants.

papers.title: PMC-VQA: Visual Instruction Tuning for Medical Visual Question Answering
papers.authors: Xiaoman Zhang,Chaoyi Wu,Ziheng Zhao,Weixiong Lin,Ya Zhang,Yanfeng Wang,Weidi Xie
papers.summary: This paper proposes a generative-based model for medical visual understanding by aligning visual information from a pre-trained vision encoder with a large language model, and establishes a scalable pipeline to construct a large-scale medical visual question-answering dataset.

papers.title: Towards A Foundation Model for Generalist Robots: Diverse Skill Learning at Scale via Automated Task and Scene Generation
papers.authors: Zhou Xian,Théophile Gervet,Zhenjia Xu,Yi-Ling Qiao,Tsun-Hsuan Wang
papers.summary: This document presents a specific idea for mining knowledge in the latest large-scale foundation models for robotics research, and advocates for using them to generate diversified tasks and scenes at scale, thereby scaling up low-level skill learning and ultimately leading to a foundation model for robotics that empowers generalist robots.

papers.title: Reasoning with Language Model Prompting: A Survey
papers.authors: Shuofei Qiao,Yixin Ou,Ningyu Zhang,Xiang Chen,Yunzhi Yao,Shumin Deng,Chuanqi Tan,Fei Huang,Huajun Chen
papers.summary: This paper provides a comprehensive survey of cutting-edge research on reasoning with language model prompting with comparisons and summaries and provides systematic resources to help beginners.

papers.title: Chameleon: Plug-and-Play Compositional Reasoning with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Pan Lu,Baolin Peng,Hao Cheng,Michel Galley,Kai-Wei Chang,Y. Wu,Song-Chun Zhu,Jianfeng Gao
papers.summary: This paper presents Chameleon, an AI system that mitigates LLM limitations by augmenting LLMs with plug-and-play modules for compositional reasoning, and shows that the GPT-4-powered planner exhibits more consistent and rational tool selection via inferring potential constraints from instructions, compared to a ChatGPT- powered planner.

papers.title: LayoutGPT: Compositional Visual Planning and Generation with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Weixi Feng,Wanrong Zhu,Tsu-Jui Fu,Varun Jampani,Arjun Reddy Akula,Xuehai He,Sugato Basu,X. Wang,William Yang Wang
papers.summary: This work proposes LayoutGPT, a method to compose in-context visual demonstrations in style sheet language to enhance the visual planning skills of LLMs, and shows superior performance in converting challenging language concepts like numerical and spatial relations to layout arrangements for faithful text-to-image generation.

papers.title: ANPL: Compiling Natural Programs with Interactive Decomposition
papers.authors: Di Huang,Ziyuan Nan,Xingui Hu,Pengwei Jin,Shaohui Peng,Yuanbo Wen,Rui Zhang,Zidong Du,Qi Guo,Yewen Pu,Yunji Chen
papers.summary: ANPL, a programming system that allows users to decompose user-specific tasks, is introduced and deployed on the Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus (ARC), a set of unique tasks that are challenging for state-of-the-art AI systems.

papers.title: Grammar Prompting for Domain-Specific Language Generation with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Bailin Wang,Zimu Wang,Xuezhi Wang,Yuan Cao,R. Saurous,Yoon Kim
papers.summary: Experiments demonstrate that grammar prompting can enable LLMs to perform competitively on a diverse set of DSL generation tasks, including semantic parsing, Overnight, GeoQuery, PDDL planning, and even molecule generation (SMILES).

papers.title: HuggingGPT: Solving AI Tasks with ChatGPT and its Friends in Hugging Face
papers.authors: Yongliang Shen,Kaitao Song,Xu Tan,D. Li,Weiming Lu,Y. Zhuang
papers.summary: HuggingGPT is a framework that leverages LLMs (e.g., ChatGPT) to connect various AI models in machine learning communities to solve AI tasks and is able to cover numerous sophisticated AI tasks in different modalities and domains and achieve impressive results in language, vision, speech, and other challenging tasks.

papers.title: Visual Instruction Tuning
papers.authors: Haotian Liu,Chunyuan Li,Qingyang Wu,Yong Jae Lee
papers.summary: This paper presents LLaVA: Large Language and Vision Assistant, an end-to-end trained large multimodal model that connects a vision encoder and LLM for general-purpose visual and language understanding and introduces GPT-4 generated visual instruction tuning data, the model and code base publicly available.

papers.title: X-LLM: Bootstrapping Advanced Large Language Models by Treating Multi-Modalities as Foreign Languages
papers.authors: Feilong Chen,Minglun Han,Haozhi Zhao,Qingyang Zhang,Jing Shi,Shuang Xu,Bo Xu
papers.summary: X-LLM is proposed, which converts Multi-modalities into foreign languages using X2L interfaces and inputs them into a large Language model (ChatGLM), and demonstrates impressive multimodel chat abilities.

papers.title: What Makes for Good Visual Tokenizers for Large Language Models?
papers.authors: Guangzhi Wang,Yixiao Ge,Xiaohan Ding,Mohan S. Kankanhalli,Ying Shan
papers.summary: A new MLLM equipped with a tailored Good Visual Tokenizer (GVT), which exhibits strong visual comprehension capability at multiple scales, without introducing extra parameters and task-specific fine-tuning.

papers.title: Enhance Reasoning Ability of Visual-Language Models via Large Language Models
papers.authors: Yueting Yang,Xintong Zhang,Wenjuan Han
papers.summary: A method called TReE is proposed, which transfers the reasoning ability of a large language model to a visual language model in zero-shot scenarios, and contains three stages: observation, thinking, and re-thinking.

papers.title: ChatBridge: Bridging Modalities with Large Language Model as a Language Catalyst
papers.authors: Zijia Zhao,Longteng Guo,Tongtian Yue,Si-Qing Chen,Shuai Shao,Xinxin Zhu,Zehuan Yuan,Jing Liu
papers.summary: It is shown that only language-paired two-modality data is sufficient to connect all modalities and ChatBridge, a novel multimodal language model that leverages the expressive capabilities of language as the catalyst to bridge the gap between various modalities, is presented.

papers.title: Contextual Object Detection with Multimodal Large Language Models
papers.authors: Yuhang Zang,Wei Li,Jun Han,Kaiyang Zhou,Chen Change Loy
papers.summary: The ContextDET is presented, a unified multimodal model that is capable of end-to-end differentiable modeling of visual-language contexts, so as to locate, identify, and associate visual objects with language inputs for human-AI interaction.

papers.title: Zero-Shot 3D Shape Correspondence
papers.authors: Ahmed Abdelreheem,A. Eldesokey,M. Ovsjanikov,Peter Wonka
papers.summary: This work introduces a fully automatic method that exploits the exceptional reasoning capabilities of recent foundation models in language and vision to tackle difficult shape correspondence problems and produces highly plausible results in a zero-shot manner, especially between strongly non-isometric shapes.

papers.title: On the Challenges and Perspectives of Foundation Models for Medical Image Analysis
papers.authors: Shaoting Zhang,Dimitris N. Metaxas
papers.summary: The opportunities, applications and future directions of large-scale pre-trained models, i.e., foundation models, for analyzing medical images, and how foundation models can be leveraged in downstream medical tasks to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of medical image analysis are discussed.

papers.title: Sticker820K: Empowering Interactive Retrieval with Stickers
papers.authors: Sijie Zhao,Yixiao Ge,Zhongang Qi,Lin Song,Xiaohan Ding,Zehua Xie,Ying Shan
papers.summary: The StickerCLIP is proposed as a benchmark model on the Sticker820K dataset, demonstrating strong superiority over the CLIP for the text-to-image retrieval task, and the recently popularized LLM is extended by means of prompt tuning, integrating its ability for sticker retrieval and allowing users to retrieve stickers through instructions.

papers.title: Transfer Visual Prompt Generator across LLMs
papers.authors: Ao Zhang,Hao Fei,Yuan Yao,Wei Ji,Li Li,Zhiyuan Liu,Tat-Seng Chua
papers.summary: This work investigates the VPG transferability across LLMs, and designs a two-stage transfer framework named VPGTrans, which is simple yet highly effective and demonstrated to significantly speed up the transfer learning process without compromising performance.

papers.title: Paxion: Patching Action Knowledge in Video-Language Foundation Models
papers.authors: Zhenhailong Wang,Ansel Blume,Sha Li,Genglin Liu,Jaemin Cho,Zineng Tang,Mohit Bansal,Heng Ji
papers.summary: This work proposes a novel framework, Paxion, along with a new Discriminative Video Dynamics Modeling (DVDM) objective, which effectively fills the gap in action knowledge understanding, while maintaining or improving performance on a wide spectrum of both object- and action-centric downstream tasks.

papers.title: ONE-PEACE: Exploring One General Representation Model Toward Unlimited Modalities
papers.authors: Peng Wang,Shijie Wang,Junyang Lin,Shuai Bai,Xiaohuan Zhou,Jingren Zhou,Xinggang Wang,Chang Zhou
papers.summary: This work releases ONE-PEACE, a highly extensible model with 4B parameters that can seamlessly align and integrate representations across vision, audio, and language modalities, and develops two modality-agnostic pretraining tasks, which align the semantic space of different modalities and capture fine-grained details within modalities concurrently.

papers.title: Album Storytelling with Iterative Story-aware Captioning and Large Language Models
papers.authors: Munan Ning,Yujia Xie,Dongdong Chen,Zeyin Song,Lu Yuan,Yonghong Tian,Qixiang Ye,Liuliang Yuan
papers.summary: This work proposes a new iterative album storytelling pipeline, which starts with an initial story and builds a story-aware caption model to refine the captions using the whole story as guidance, then feeds into the LLMs to generate a new refined story.

papers.title: S-CLIP: Semi-supervised Vision-Language Pre-training using Few Specialist Captions
papers.authors: Sangwoo Mo,Min-Kyung Kim,Kyungmin Lee,Jinwoo Shin
papers.summary: S-CLIP is proposed, a semi-supervised learning method for training CLIP that utilizes additional unpaired images and employs two pseudo-labeling strategies specifically designed for contrastive learning and the language modality.

papers.title: Cream: Visually-Situated Natural Language Understanding with Contrastive Reading Model and Frozen Large Language Models
papers.authors: Geewook Kim,Hodong Lee,Daehee Kim,Haeji Jung,S. Park,Yoon Kim,Sangdoo Yun,T. Kil,Bado Lee,Seunghyun Park
papers.summary: The Contrastive Reading Model (Cream) is proposed, a novel neural architecture designed to enhance the language-image understanding capability of LLMs by capturing intricate details typically overlooked by existing methods.

papers.title: Accelerating the integration of ChatGPT and other large‐scale AI models into biomedical research and healthcare
papers.authors: Ding‐Qiao Wang,Long‐Yu Feng,Jin‐Guo Ye,Jin‐Gen Zou,Yingfeng Zheng

papers.title: VQAMix: Conditional Triplet Mixup for Medical Visual Question Answering
papers.authors: Haifan Gong,Guanqi Chen,Mingzhi Mao,Z. Li,Guanbin Li
papers.summary: This paper proposes a simple yet effective data augmentation method, VQAMix, which generates more labeled training samples by linearly combining a pair of VQA samples, which can be easily embedded into any visual-language model to boost performance.

papers.title: Towards Medical Artificial General Intelligence via Knowledge-Enhanced Multimodal Pretraining
papers.authors: Bingqian Lin,Zicong Chen,Mingjie Li,Haokun Lin,Hang Xu,Yi Zhu,Jian-zhuo Liu,Wenjia Cai,Lei Yang,Shen Zhao,Chenfei Wu,Ling Chen,Xiaojun Chang,Yi Yang,L. Xing,Xiaodan Liang
papers.summary: The proposed MOTOR successfully mimics the human practice of fulfilling a"medical student" to accelerate the process of becoming a"specialist" and believes that this work makes a significant stride in realizing MAGI.

papers.title: Multi-modal Pre-training for Medical Vision-language Understanding and Generation: An Empirical Study with A New Benchmark
papers.authors: Li Xu,Bo Liu,Ameer Hamza Khan,Lu Fan,Xiao-Ming Wu
papers.summary: RadioGraphy Captions (RGC), a high-quality, multi-modality radiographic dataset containing 18,434 image-caption pairs collected from an open-access online database MedPix, is proposed, which can be used as a pre-training dataset or a new benchmark for medical report generation and medical image-text retrieval.

papers.title: SheetCopilot: Bringing Software Productivity to the Next Level through Large Language Models
papers.authors: Hongxin Li,Jingran Su,Yuntao Chen,Qing Li,Zhaoxiang Zhang
papers.summary: This work proposes a SheetCopilot agent which takes natural language task and control spreadsheet to fulfill the requirements, and proposes a set of atomic actions as an abstraction of spreadsheet software functionalities.

papers.title: TaskMatrix.AI: Completing Tasks by Connecting Foundation Models with Millions of APIs
papers.authors: Yaobo Liang,Chenfei Wu,Ting Song,Wenshan Wu,Yan Xia,Yu Liu,Yangyiwen Ou,Shuai Lu,Lei Ji,Shaoguang Mao,Yun Wang,Linjun Shou,Ming Gong,Nan Duan
papers.summary: The vision of how to build such an ecosystem is presented, each key component is explained, and study cases are used to illustrate both the feasibility of this vision and the main challenges the authors need to address next.

papers.title: Tool Learning with Foundation Models
papers.authors: Yujia Qin,Shengding Hu,Yankai Lin,Weize Chen,Ning Ding,Ganqu Cui,Zheni Zeng,Yufei Huang,Chaojun Xiao,Chi Han,Y. Fung,Yusheng Su,Huadong Wang,Cheng Qian,Runchu Tian,Kunlun Zhu,Shi Liang,Xingyu Shen,Bokai Xu,Zhen Zhang,Yining Ye,Bo Li,Ziwei Tang,Jing Yi,Yu Zhu,Zhenning Dai,Lan Yan,Xin Cong,Ya-Ting Lu,Weilin Zhao,Yuxiang Huang,Jun-Han Yan,Xu Han,Xian Sun,Dahai Li,Jason Phang,Cheng Yang,Tongshuang Wu,Heng Ji,Zhiyuan Liu,Maosong Sun
papers.summary: A systematic investigation of tool learning is presented, including its cognitive origins, the paradigm shift of foundation models, and the complementary roles of tools and models to inspire future research in integrating tools with foundation models.

papers.title: Instruct2Act: Mapping Multi-modality Instructions to Robotic Actions with Large Language Model
papers.authors: Siyuan Huang,Zhengkai Jiang,Hao-Wen Dong,Y. Qiao,Peng Gao,Hongsheng Li
papers.summary: This paper presents Instruct2Act, a framework that utilizes Large Language Models to map multi-modal instructions to sequential actions for robotic manipulation tasks, employing the LLM model to generate Python programs that constitute a comprehensive perception, planning, and action loop for robotic tasks.

papers.title: Matcher: Segment Anything with One Shot Using All-Purpose Feature Matching
papers.authors: Yang Liu,Muzhi Zhu,Hengtao Li,Hao Chen,Xinlong Wang,Chunhua Shen
papers.summary: This work presents Matcher, which segments anything with one shot by integrating an all-purpose feature extraction model and a class-agnostic segmentation model, and proposes a novel instance-level matching strategy for controllable mask merging.

papers.title: CREATOR: Disentangling Abstract and Concrete Reasonings of Large Language Models through Tool Creation
papers.authors: Cheng Qian,Chi Han,Y. Fung,Yujia Qin,Zhiyuan Liu,Heng Ji

papers.title: ReWOO: Decoupling Reasoning from Observations for Efficient Augmented Language Models
papers.authors: Binfeng Xu,Zhiyuan Peng,Bowen Lei,Subhabrata Mukherjee,Yuchen Liu,Dongkuan Xu
papers.summary: This study proposes a modular paradigm ReWOO (Reasoning WithOut Observation) that detaches the reasoning process from external observations, thus significantly reducing token consumption and demonstrating robustness under tool-failure scenarios.

papers.title: Responsible Task Automation: Empowering Large Language Models as Responsible Task Automators
papers.authors: Zhizheng Zhang,Xiaoyi Zhang,Wenxuan Xie,Yan Lu
papers.summary: This paper presents Responsible Task Automation (ResponsibleTA) as a fundamental framework to facilitate responsible collaboration between LLM-based coordinators and executors for task automation with three empowered capabilities: predicting the feasibility of the commands for executors, verifying the completeness of executors and enhancing the security.

papers.title: RestGPT: Connecting Large Language Models with Real-World Applications via RESTful APIs
papers.authors: Yifan Song,Weimin Xiong,Dawei Zhu,Cheng Li,Ke Wang,Ye Tian,Sujian Li
papers.summary: This paper introduces RestGPT, which leverages LLMs to solve user requests by connecting with RESTful APIs and proposes a coarse-to-fine online planning mechanism to enhance the ability of planning and API selection.

papers.title: Data-Copilot: Bridging Billions of Data and Humans with Autonomous Workflow
papers.authors: Wenqi Zhang,Yongliang Shen,Weiming Lu,Y. Zhuang
papers.summary: This work proposes Data-Copilot, an LLM-based system that connects numerous data sources on one end and caters to diverse human demands on the other end, and autonomously transforms raw data into visualization results that best match the user's intent.

papers.title: A Survey for In-context Learning
papers.authors: Qingxiu Dong,Lei Li,Damai Dai,Ce Zheng,Zhiyong Wu,Baobao Chang,Xu Sun,Jingjing Xu,Zhifang Sui
papers.summary: This paper presents a formal definition of ICL and clarify its correlation to related studies, and organizes and discusses advanced techniques, including training strategies, demonstration designing strategies, as well as related analysis.

papers.title: SkinGPT-4: An Interactive Dermatology Diagnostic System with Visual Large Language Model
papers.authors: Juexiao Zhou,Xiao-Zhen He,Liyuan Sun,Jian-Hui Xu,Xiuying Chen,Yuetan Chu,Longxi Zhou,Xingyu Liao,Bin Zhang,Xin Gao
papers.summary: Though SkinGPT-4 is not a substitute for doctors, it could enhance users' comprehension of their medical conditions, facilitate improve communication between patients and doctors, expedite the diagnostic process for dermatologists, and potentially promote human-centred care and healthcare equity in underdeveloped areas.

papers.title: SkinGPT: A Dermatology Diagnostic System with Vision Large Language Model
papers.authors: Juexiao Zhou,Xin Gao
papers.summary: The ability to deploy it locally and protect user privacy makes SkinGPT an attractive option for patients seeking an accurate and reliable diagnosis of their skin conditions and the system can autonomously determine the characteristics and categories of skin conditions, perform analysis, and provide treatment recommendations.

papers.title: ChatVideo: A Tracklet-centric Multimodal and Versatile Video Understanding System
papers.authors: Junke Wang,Dongdong Chen,Chong Luo,Xiyang Dai,Lu Yuan,Zuxuan Wu,Yu-Gang Jiang
papers.summary: The vision for multimodal and versatile video understanding is presented and a prototype system, built upon a tracklet-centric paradigm, which treats tracklets as the basic video unit and employs various Video Foundation Models to annotate their properties e.g., appearance, motion, etc.

papers.title: Caption Anything: Interactive Image Description with Diverse Multimodal Controls
papers.authors: Teng Wang,Jinrui Zhang,Junjie Fei,Yixiao Ge,Hao Zheng,Yun-Qiu Tang,Zhe Li,Mingqi Gao,Shanshan Zhao,Ying Shan,Feng Zheng
papers.summary: Caption AnyThing (CAT) is presented, a foundation model augmented image captioning framework supporting a wide range of multimodel controls: 1) visual controls, including points, boxes, and trajectories; 2) language controls, such as sentiment, length, language, and factuality.

papers.title: Vision-Language Models in Remote Sensing: Current Progress and Future Trends
papers.authors: Congcong Wen,Yuan Hu,Xiang Li,Zhenghang Yuan,Xiao Xiang Zhu
papers.summary: A comprehensive review of the research on vision-language models in remote sensing, summarizing the latest progress, highlighting the current challenges, and identifying potential research opportunities is provided.

papers.title: InstructBLIP: Towards General-purpose Vision-Language Models with Instruction Tuning
papers.authors: Wenliang Dai,Junnan Li,Dongxu Li,A. M. H. Tiong,Junqi Zhao,Weisheng Wang,Boyang Li,Pascale Fung,Steven Hoi
papers.summary: This paper conducts a systematic and comprehensive study on vision-language instruction tuning based on the pretrained BLIP-2 models, and introduces an instruction-aware Query Transformer, which extracts informative features tailored to the given instruction.

papers.title: ArtGPT-4: Artistic Vision-Language Understanding with Adapter-enhanced MiniGPT-4
papers.authors: Zheng Yuan,HU Xue,Xinyi Wang,Yongming Liu,Zhuanzhe Zhao,Kun Wang
papers.summary: A novel multimodal model called ArtGPT-4 has been proposed to address some challenges in image understanding, particularly in artistic pictures, and novel benchmarks for evaluating the performance of vision-language models are proposed.

papers.title: On the Hidden Mystery of OCR in Large Multimodal Models
papers.authors: Yuliang Liu,Zhang Li,Hongliang Li,Wenwen Yu,Mingxin Huang,Dezhi Peng,Mingyu Liu,Mingrui Chen,Chunyuan Li,Lianwen Jin,Xiang Bai
papers.summary: This study conducted a comprehensive study of existing publicly available multimodal models, evaluating their performance in text recognition, text-based visual question answering, key information extraction, and handwritten mathematical expression recognition.

papers.title: Evaluating Object Hallucination in Large Vision-Language Models
papers.authors: Yifan Li,Yifan Du,Kun Zhou,Jinpeng Wang,Wayne Xin Zhao,Ji-rong Wen
papers.summary: This work presents the first systematic study on object hallucination of LVLMs, and designs an improved evaluation method by proposing a polling-based query method called POPE, which can evaluate the object hallucinated objects in a more stable and flexible way.

papers.title: X-IQE: eXplainable Image Quality Evaluation for Text-to-Image Generation with Visual Large Language Models
papers.authors: Yixiong Chen,Li Liu,C. Ding
papers.summary: A novel explainable image quality evaluation approach called X-IQE, which leverages visual large language models (LLMs) to evaluate text-to-image generation methods by generating textual explanations by utilizing a hierarchical Chain of Thought to enable MiniGPT-4 to produce self-consistent, unbiased texts that are highly correlated with human evaluation.

papers.title: Going Denser with Open-Vocabulary Part Segmentation
papers.authors: Pei Sun,Shoufa Chen,Chenchen Zhu,Fanyi Xiao,Ping Luo,Saining Xie,Zhicheng Yan
papers.summary: A detector with the ability to predict both open-vocabulary objects and their part segmentation and training on the joint of part-level, object-level and image-level data to build the multi-granularity alignment between language and image.

papers.title: LLM Itself Can Read and Generate CXR Images
papers.authors: Suhyeon Lee,Won Jun Kim,Jong-Chul Ye
papers.summary: This work presents a novel method to fine-tune a pre-trained LLM to read and generate images like text without any structural changes, extra training objectives, or the need for training an ad-hoc network while still preserving the of the instruction-following capability of the LLM.

papers.title: VideoLLM: Modeling Video Sequence with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Guo Chen,Yin-Dong Zheng,Jiahao Wang,Jilan Xu,Yifei Huang,Junting Pan,Yi Wang,Yali Wang,Y. Qiao,Tong Lu,Limin Wang
papers.summary: This work proposes a novel framework called VideoLLM that leverages the sequence reasoning capabilities of pre-trained LLMs from natural language processing (NLP) for video sequence understanding and demonstrates that the understanding and Reasoning capabilities of LLMs can be effectively transferred to video understanding tasks.

papers.title: Interactive Data Synthesis for Systematic Vision Adaptation via LLMs-AIGCs Collaboration
papers.authors: Qifan Yu,Juncheng Li,Wentao Ye,Siliang Tang,Yueting Zhuang
papers.summary: This work extensively study how LLMs communicate with AIGC model to achieve more controllable image generation and makes the first attempt to collaborate them for automatic data augmentation for a variety of downstream tasks.

papers.title: ReSee: Responding through Seeing Fine-grained Visual Knowledge in Open-domain Dialogue
papers.authors: Haoqin Tu,Yitong Li,Fei Mi,Zhongliang Yang
papers.summary: Empirical, encouraging results not only demonstrate the effectiveness of introducing visual knowledge at both entity and turn level but also verify the proposed model ReSee outperforms several state-of-the-art methods on automatic and human evaluations.

papers.title: MemeCap: A Dataset for Captioning and Interpreting Memes
papers.authors: EunJeong Hwang,V. Shwartz
papers.summary: The task of meme captioning is presented and a new dataset, MemeCap, containing 6.3K memes along with the title of the post containing the meme, the meme captions, the literal image caption, and the visual metaphors is released.

papers.title: DetGPT: Detect What You Need via Reasoning
papers.authors: Renjie Pi,Jiahui Gao,Shizhe Diao,Rui Pan,Hanze Dong,Jipeng Zhang,Lewei Yao,Jianhua Han,Hang Xu,Lingpeng Kong Tong Zhang
papers.summary: This paper introduces a new paradigm for object detection that is called reasoning-based object detection, and leverages state-of-the-art multi-modal models and open-vocabulary object detectors to perform reasoning within the context of the user's instructions and the visual scene.

papers.title: PandaGPT: One Model To Instruction-Follow Them All
papers.authors: Yixuan Su,Tian Lan,Huayang Li,Jialu Xu,Yan Wang,Deng Cai
papers.summary: PandaGPT is an approach to emPower large lANguage moDels with visual and Auditory instruction-following capabilities that can perform complex tasks such as detailed image description generation, writing stories inspired by videos, and answering questions about audios.

papers.title: NavGPT: Explicit Reasoning in Vision-and-Language Navigation with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Gengze Zhou,Yicong Hong,Qi Wu
papers.summary: The NavGPT is introduced, a purely LLM-based instruction-following navigation agent, to reveal the reasoning capability of GPT models in complex embodied scenes by performing zero-shot sequential action prediction for vision-and-language navigation (VLN).

papers.title: Chatting Makes Perfect - Chat-based Image Retrieval
papers.authors: Matan Levy,Rami Ben-Ari,N. Darshan,D. Lischinski
papers.summary: This work introduces ChatIR: a chat-based image retrieval system that engages in a conversation with the user to elicit information, in addition to an initial query, in order to clarify the user's search intent.

papers.title: Dense and Aligned Captions (DAC) Promote Compositional Reasoning in VL Models
papers.authors: Sivan Doveh,Assaf Arbelle,Sivan Harary,Roei Herzig,Donghyun Kim,Paola Cascante-Bonilla,Amit Alfassy,R. Panda,R. Giryes,R. Feris,S. Ullman,Leonid Karlinsky
papers.summary: A fine-tuning approach is proposed for automatically treating two factors limiting the VL models' compositional reasoning performance: the caption quality, or in other words `image-alignment', of the texts and the `density' of the captions in the sense of mentioning all the details appearing on the image.

papers.title: Exploring Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation without Human Labels
papers.authors: Jun Chen,Deyao Zhu,Guocheng Qian,Bernard Ghanem,Zhicheng Yan,Chenchen Zhu,Fanyi Xiao,Mohamed Elhoseiny,S. Culatana
papers.summary: This work presents ZeroSeg, a novel method that leverages the existing pretrained vision-language (VL) model to train open-vocabulary zero-shot semantic segmentation models, achieving state-of-the-art performance when compared to other zero- shot segmentation methods under the same training data, while also performing competitively compared to strongly supervised methods.

papers.title: GPT4Image: Can Large Pre-trained Models Help Vision Models on Perception Tasks?
papers.authors: N. Ding,Yehui Tang,Zhongqian Fu,Chaoting Xu,Kai Han,Yunhe Wang
papers.summary: This paper presents a new learning paradigm in which the knowledge extracted from large pre-trained models are utilized to help models like CNN and ViT learn enhanced representations and achieve better performance.

papers.title: Youku-mPLUG: A 10 Million Large-scale Chinese Video-Language Dataset for Pre-training and Benchmarks
papers.authors: Haiyang Xu,Qinghao Ye,Xuan-Wei Wu,Mingshi Yan,Yuan Miao,Jiabo Ye,Guohai Xu,Anwen Hu,Yaya Shi,Guangwei Xu,Chenliang Li,Qingfang Qian,Maofei Que,J. Zhang,Xiaoyan Zeng,Feiyan Huang
papers.summary: The zero-shot instruction understanding experiment indicates that pretraining with Youku-mPLUG can enhance the ability to comprehend overall and detailed visual semantics, recognize scene text, and leverage open-domain knowledge.

papers.title: M3IT: A Large-Scale Dataset towards Multi-Modal Multilingual Instruction Tuning
papers.authors: Lei Li,Yuwei Yin,Shicheng Li,Liang Chen,Peiyi Wang,Shuhuai Ren,Mukai Li,Yazheng Yang,Jingjing Xu,Xu Sun,Lingpeng Kong,Qi Liu
papers.summary: Ying-VLM, a VLM model trained on the M$^3$IT dataset, is developed, showcasing its potential to answer complex questions requiring world knowledge, generalize to unseen video tasks, and comprehend unseen instructions in Chinese.

papers.title: Modular Visual Question Answering via Code Generation
papers.authors: Sanjay Subramanian,Medhini G. Narasimhan,Kushal Khangaonkar,Kevin Yang,Arsha Nagrani,C. Schmid,Andy Zeng,Trevor Darrell,D. Klein
papers.summary: This work presents a framework that formulates visual question answering as modular code generation that requires no additional training and relies on pre- trained language models, visual models pre-trained on image-caption pairs, and fifty VQA examples used for in-context learning.

papers.title: Artificial General Intelligence for Medical Imaging
papers.authors: Xiang Li,Lu Zhang,Zihao Wu,Zheng Liu,Lin Zhao,Yixuan Yuan,Jun Liu,Gang Li,Dajiang Zhu,Pingkuan Yan,Quanzheng Li,Wei Liu,Tianming Liu,Dinggang Shen
papers.summary: In this review, the importance of integrating clinical expertise, domain knowledge, and multimodal capabilities into AGI models, focusing on foundational Large Language Models, Large Vision Models, and Large Multimodal Models, is emphasized.

papers.title: Video-ChatGPT: Towards Detailed Video Understanding via Large Vision and Language Models
papers.authors: Muhammad Maaz,Hanoona Rasheed,Salman Khan,F. Khan
papers.summary: This work introduces Video-ChatGPT, a multimodal model that merges a video-adapted visual encoder with a LLM, and develops a quantiative evaluation framework for video-based dialogue models to objectively analyse the strengths and weaknesses of proposed models.

papers.title: Customizing General-Purpose Foundation Models for Medical Report Generation
papers.authors: Bang Yang,Asif Raza,Yuexian Zou,Tong Zhang
papers.summary: This work proposes customizing off-the-shelf general-purpose large-scale pre-trained models, i.e., foundation models (FMs), in computer vision and natural language processing with a specific focus on medical report generation and demonstrates that unfreezing EVA-ViT-g to learn medical image representations, followed by parameter-efficient training of ChatGLM-6B to capture the writing styles of medical reports, is essential for achieving optimal results.

papers.title: Segment Everything Everywhere All at Once
papers.authors: Xueyan Zou,Jianwei Yang,Hao Zhang,Feng Li,Linjie Li,Jianfeng Gao,Yong Jae Lee
papers.summary: SEEM is a promptable, interactive model for Segmenting Everything Everywhere all at once in an image by incorporating learnable memory prompts to retain dialog history information via mask-guided cross-attention.

papers.title: Vision and Structured-Language Pretraining for Cross-Modal Food Retrieval
papers.authors: Mustafa Shukor,Nicolas Thome,M. Cord
papers.summary: VLPCook outperforms current SoTA by a significant margin on the task of Cross-Modal Food Retrieval on the large Recipe1M dataset and validates the generalization of the approach to other tasks and domains with structured text such as the Medical domain on the ROCO dataset.

papers.title: BLIP-2: Bootstrapping Language-Image Pre-training with Frozen Image Encoders and Large Language Models
papers.authors: Junnan Li,Dongxu Li,S. Savarese,Steven Hoi
papers.summary: BLIP-2 achieves state-of-the-art performance on various vision-language tasks, despite having significantly fewer trainable parameters than existing methods, and is demonstrated's emerging capabilities of zero-shot image-to-text generation that can follow natural language instructions.

papers.title: Language Is Not All You Need: Aligning Perception with Language Models
papers.authors: Shaohan Huang,Li Dong,Wenhui Wang,Y. Hao,Saksham Singhal,Shuming Ma,Tengchao Lv,Lei Cui,O. Mohammed,Qiang Liu,Kriti Aggarwal,Zewen Chi,Johan Bjorck,Vishrav Chaudhary,Subhojit Som,Xia Song,Furu Wei
papers.summary: This work introduces Kosmos-1, a Multimodal Large Language Model (MLLM) that can perceive general modalities, learn in context, and follow instructions, and shows that MLLMs can benefit from cross-modal transfer, i.e., transfer knowledge from language to multimodals, and from multimodal to language.

papers.title: ChatGPT Asks, BLIP-2 Answers: Automatic Questioning Towards Enriched Visual Descriptions
papers.authors: Deyao Zhu,Jun Chen,Kilichbek Haydarov,Xiaoqian Shen,Wenxuan Zhang,Mohamed Elhoseiny
papers.summary: This paper introduces ChatCaptioner, a novel automatic-questioning method deployed in image captioning that identifies 53% more objects within the image than BLIP-2 alone measured by WordNet synset matching.

papers.title: Scaling Vision-Language Models with Sparse Mixture of Experts
papers.authors: Sheng Shen,Z. Yao,Chunyuan Li,Trevor Darrell,K. Keutzer,Yuxiong He
papers.summary: The effectiveness of MoE in scaling vision-language models is explored, demonstrating its potential to achieve state-of-the-art performance on a range of benchmarks over dense models of equivalent computational cost.

papers.title: IRGen: Generative Modeling for Image Retrieval
papers.authors: Yidan Zhang,Ting Zhang,Dong Chen,Yujing Wang,Qi Chen,Xingxu Xie,Hao Sun,Weiwei Deng,Qi Zhang,Fan Yang,Mao Yang,Q. Liao,B. Guo
papers.summary: The framework, IRGen, is a unified model that enables end-to-end differentiable search, thus achieving superior performance thanks to direct optimization and tackling the key technical challenge of converting an image into quite a short sequence of semantic units in order to enable efficient and effective retrieval.

papers.title: EVA-02: A Visual Representation for Neon Genesis
papers.authors: Yuxin Fang,Quan Sun,Xinggang Wang,Tiejun Huang,Xinlong Wang,Yue Cao
papers.summary: EVA-02, a next-generation Transformer-based visual representation pre-trained to reconstruct strong and robust language-aligned vision features via masked image modeling, is launched, demonstrating superior performance compared to prior state-of-the-art approaches across various representative vision tasks, while utilizing significantly fewer parameters and compute budgets.

papers.title: Equivariant Similarity for Vision-Language Foundation Models
papers.authors: Tan Wang,Kevin Lin,Linjie Li,Chung-Ching Lin,Zhengyuan Yang,Hanwang Zhang,Zicheng Liu,Lijuan Wang
papers.summary: This study proposes EqSim, a regularization loss that can be efficiently calculated from any two matched training pairs and easily pluggable into existing image-text retrieval fine-tuning and presents a new challenging benchmark EqBen, the first to focus on "visual-minimal change".

papers.title: LLaMA-Adapter: Efficient Fine-tuning of Language Models with Zero-init Attention
papers.authors: Renrui Zhang,Jiaming Han,Aojun Zhou,Xiangfei Hu,Shilin Yan,Pan Lu,Hongsheng Li,Peng Gao,Y. Qiao
papers.summary: A zero-initialized attention mechanism with zero gating is proposed, which adaptively injects the new instructional cues into LLaMA, while effectively preserves its pre-trained knowledge on traditional vision and language tasks, demonstrating the superior generalization capacity of the approach.

papers.title: A Study of Autoregressive Decoders for Multi-Tasking in Computer Vision
papers.authors: L. Beyer,Bo Wan,Gagan Madan,Filip Pavetic,A. Steiner,Alexander Kolesnikov,André Susano Pinto,Emanuele Bugliarello,Xiao Wang,Qihang Yu,Liang-Chieh Chen,Xiaohua Zhai
papers.summary: This work takes a close look at autoregressive decoders for multi-task learning in multimodal computer vision, including classification, captioning, visual question answering, and optical character recognition and compares these to well-tuned single-task baselines to highlight the cost incurred by multi-tasking.

papers.title: Not All Features Matter: Enhancing Few-shot CLIP with Adaptive Prior Refinement
papers.authors: Xiang-yu Zhu,Renrui Zhang,Bowei He,A-Long Zhou,D. Wang,Bingyan Zhao,Peng Gao
papers.summary: This paper proposes APE, an Adaptive Prior rEfinement method for CLIP's pre-trained knowledge, which achieves superior accuracy with high computational efficiency and introduces two model variants, a training-free APE and aTraining-required APE-T.

papers.title: On the Opportunities and Challenges of Foundation Models for Geospatial Artificial Intelligence
papers.authors: Gengchen Mai,Weiming Huang,Jin Sun,Suhang Song,Deepak Mishra,Ninghao Liu,Song Gao,Tianming Liu,G. Cong,Yingjie Hu,Chris Cundy,Ziyuan Li,Rui Zhu,Ni Lao
papers.summary: It is proposed that one of the major challenges of developing a FM for GeoAI is to address the multimodality nature of geospatial tasks and the possibility of a multimodal foundation model which can reason over various types ofGeoAI data through geosp spatial alignments is suggested.

papers.title: MVP-SEG: Multi-View Prompt Learning for Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation
papers.authors: Jie Guo,Qimeng Wang,Yan Gao,Xiaolong Jiang,Xu Tang,Yao Hu,Baochang Zhang
papers.summary: Experiments show that the multi-view prompts learned from seen categories have strong generalization to unseen categories, and MVP-SEG+ which combines the knowledge transfer stage significantly outperforms previous methods on several benchmarks, justifying that MVP- SEG does lead to better focus on different local parts.

papers.title: Multimodal Neural Databases
papers.authors: Giovanni Trappolini,Andrea Santilli,E. Rodolà,A. Halevy,F. Silvestri
papers.summary: This paper presents the first architecture able to answer complex database-like queries that involve reasoning over different input modalities, such as text and images, at scale, and presents the potential of these new techniques to process unstructured data coming from different modalities.

papers.title: Visual Tuning
papers.authors: Bruce X. B. Yu,Jianlong Chang,Haixin Wang,Lin Liu,Shijie Wang,Zhiyu Wang,Junfan Lin,Lingxi Xie,Haojie Li,Zhouchen Lin,Qi Tian,Chang Wen Chen
papers.summary: This survey characterizes a large and thoughtful selection of recent works, providing a systematic and comprehensive overview of existing work and models and categorizes recent visual tuning techniques into five groups: prompt tuning, adapter tuning, parameter tuning, and remapping tuning.

papers.title: Multi-Prompt with Depth Partitioned Cross-Modal Learning
papers.authors: Yiqi Wang,Xianda Guo,Zheng Hua Zhu,Yingjie Tian
papers.summary: This study introduces the Partitioned Multi-modal Prompt (PMPO), a multi- modal prompting technique that extends the soft prompt from a single learnable prompt to multiple prompts, and incorporates prior information from manually designed templates and learnable multi-prompts, thus improving the generalization capabilities of the approach.

papers.title: Self-Chained Image-Language Model for Video Localization and Question Answering
papers.authors: Shoubin Yu,Jaemin Cho,Prateek Yadav,Mohit Bansal
papers.summary: Self-Chained Video Localization-Answering (SeViLA), a novel framework that leverages a single image-language model (BLIP-2) to tackle both temporal keyframe localization and QA on videos, outperforms several strong baselines/previous works on five video QA and event prediction tasks, and achieves the state-of-the-art in both fine-tuning and zero-shot settings.

papers.title: Simple Token-Level Confidence Improves Caption Correctness
papers.authors: Suzanne Petryk,Spencer Whitehead,Joseph Gonzalez,Trevor Darrell,Anna Rohrbach,Marcus Rohrbach
papers.summary: This work explores Token-Level Confidence, or TLC, as a simple yet surprisingly effective method to assess caption correctness, and fine-tune a vision-language model on image captioning, input an image and proposed caption to the model, and aggregate either algebraic or learned token confidences over words or sequences to estimate image-caption consistency.

papers.title: Enhancing Vision-Language Pre-Training with Jointly Learned Questioner and Dense Captioner
papers.authors: Zikang Liu,Sihan Chen,Longteng Guo,Handong Li,Xingjian He,J. Liu
papers.summary: A novel method called Joint QA and DC GEneration (JADE), which utilizes a pre-trained multimodal model and easily-crawled image-text pairs to automatically generate and filter large-scale VQA and dense captioning datasets.

papers.title: Prompt ChatGPT In MNER: Improved multimodal named entity recognition method based on auxiliary refining knowledge from ChatGPT
papers.authors: Jinyuan Li,Han Li,Zhufeng Pan,Gang Pan
papers.summary: This paper uses ChatGPT as an implicit knowledge engine to acquire auxiliary refined knowledge, thereby bolstering the model's performance in MNER tasks and significantly outperforms all existing state-of-the-art methods on two classic MNER datasets.

papers.title: SmartTrim: Adaptive Tokens and Parameters Pruning for Efficient Vision-Language Models
papers.authors: Zekun Wang,Jingchang Chen,Wangchunshu Zhou,Ming Liu,Bing Qin
papers.summary: This work proposes an adaptive acceleration method SmartTrim for VLMs, which adjusts the inference overhead based on the complexity of instances, and incorporates lightweight trimming modules into the backbone to perform task-specific pruning on redundant inputs and parameters without the need for additional pre-training or data augmentation.

papers.title: Zero-shot Visual Question Answering with Language Model Feedback
papers.authors: Yifan Du,Junyi Li,Tianyi Tang,Wayne Xin Zhao,Ji-rong Wen
papers.summary: A novel language model guided captioning approach, LAMOC, for knowledge-based visual question answering (VQA), which outperforms several competitive zero-shot methods and even achieves comparable results to a fine-tuned VLP model.

papers.title: VAST: A Vision-Audio-Subtitle-Text Omni-Modality Foundation Model and Dataset
papers.authors: Sihan Chen,Handong Li,Qunbo Wang,Zijia Zhao,Ming-Ting Sun,Xinxin Zhu,J. Liu
papers.summary: Based on the proposed VAST-27M dataset, an omni-modality video-text foundational model named VAST is trained, which can perceive and process vision, audio, and subtitle modalities from video, and better support various tasks including vision- Text, audio-text, and multi-modal video- text tasks (retrieval, captioning and QA).

papers.title: Learning without Forgetting for Vision-Language Models
papers.authors: Da-Wei Zhou,Yuanhan Zhang,Jingyi Ning,Han-Jia Ye,De-chuan Zhan,Ziwei Liu
papers.summary: ProjectiOn Fusion (PROOF) is proposed that enables VLMs to learn without forgetting and jointly adjusting visual and textual features, the model can capture semantic information with stronger representation ability.

papers.title: Benchmarking Robustness of Adaptation Methods on Pre-trained Vision-Language Models
papers.authors: Shuo Chen,Jindong Gu,Zhen Han,Yunpu Ma,Philip H. S. Torr,Volker Tresp
papers.summary: The robustness of 11 widely-used adaptation methods across 4 vision-language datasets under multimodal corruptions is assessed and it is indicated that increasing the number of adaptation data and parameters does not guarantee enhanced robustness; instead it results in even lower robustness.

papers.title: Q: How to Specialize Large Vision-Language Models to Data-Scarce VQA Tasks? A: Self-Train on Unlabeled Images!
papers.authors: Zaid Khan,B. Vijaykumar,S. Schulter,Xiang Yu,Y. Fu,Manmohan Chandraker
papers.summary: This work introduces SelTDA (Self-Taught Data Augmentation), a strategy for finetuning large VLMs on small-scale VQA datasets and describes a series of experiments showing that the proposed strategy increases robustness to adversarially searched questions, counterfactual examples and rephrasings, improves domain generalization, and results in greater retention of numerical reasoning skills.

papers.title: A Survey of Vision-Language Pre-training from the Lens of Multimodal Machine Translation
papers.authors: Jeremy Gwinnup,Kevin Duh
papers.summary: The landscape of language-and-vision pre-training from the lens of multimodal machine translation is surveyed, which summarizes the common architectures, pre- training objectives, and datasets from literature and conjecture what further is needed to make progress on multimodAL machine translation.

papers.title: Open-Ended Medical Visual Question Answering Through Prefix Tuning of Language Models
papers.authors: Tom van Sonsbeek,Mohammad Mahdi Derakhshani,Ivona Najdenkoska,Cees G. M. Snoek,M. Worring
papers.summary: This work focuses on open-ended VQA and motivated by the recent advances in language models consider it as a generative task, and introduces a novel method particularly suited for small, domain-specific, medical datasets.

papers.title: SecureBERT: A Domain-Specific Language Model for Cybersecurity
papers.authors: Ehsan Aghaei,Xi Niu,W. Shadid,E. Al-Shaer
papers.summary: This paper proposes SecureBERT, a cybersecurity language model capable of capturing text connotations in cybersecurity text and therefore successful in automation for many critical cybersecurity tasks that would otherwise rely on human expertise and time-consuming manual procedures.

papers.title: Medical Image Understanding with Pretrained Vision Language Models: A Comprehensive Study
papers.authors: Ziyuan Qin,Huahui Yi,Qicheng Lao,Kang Li
papers.summary: It is shown that well-designed medical prompts are the key to elicit knowledge from pre-trained VLMs, and by prompting with expressive attributes that are shared between domains, the VLM can carry the knowledge across domains and improve its generalization.

papers.title: Harnessing the Power of LLMs in Practice: A Survey on ChatGPT and Beyond
papers.authors: Jingfeng Yang,Hongye Jin,Ruixiang Tang,Xiaotian Han,Qizhang Feng,Haoming Jiang,Bing Yin,Xia Hu
papers.summary: A comprehensive and practical guide for practitioners and end-users working with Large Language Models in their downstream natural language processing (NLP) tasks, enabling the successful implementation of these models in a wide range of NLP tasks.

papers.title: Improving accuracy of GPT-3/4 results on biomedical data using a retrieval-augmented language model
papers.authors: D. Soong,S. Sridhar,Han Si,J. Wagner,Ana Caroline Costa S'a,Christina Y. Yu,Kubra Karagoz,Meijian Guan,Hisham K Hamadeh,Brandon Higgs
papers.summary: It is suggested that RetA models, supplemented with domain-specific corpora, may outperform general-purpose LLMs in accuracy and relevance within specific domains.

papers.title: Utilizing ChatGPT to Enhance Clinical Trial Enrollment
papers.authors: Georgios Peikos,S. Symeonidis,Pranav Kasela,G. Pasi

papers.title: SUR-adapter: Enhancing Text-to-Image Pre-trained Diffusion Models with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Shan Zhong,Zhongzhan Huang,Wushao Wen,Jinghui Qin,Liang Lin
papers.summary: This work proposes a simple-yet-effective parameter-efficient fine-tuning approach called the Semantic Understanding and Reasoning adapter (SUR-adapter) for pre-trained diffusion models that can make text-to-image diffusion models easier to use with better user experience.

papers.title: Retrieving Multimodal Information for Augmented Generation: A Survey
papers.authors: Ruochen Zhao,Hailin Chen,Weishi Wang,Fangkai Jiao,Xuan Long Do,Chengwei Qin,Bosheng Ding,Xiaobao Guo,Minzhi Li,Xingxuan Li,Shafiq R. Joty
papers.summary: This survey provides an in-depth review of retrieval-augmented generation in different modalities and discusses potential future directions of this emerging field.

papers.title: TeamS at VQA-Med 2021: BBN-Orchestra for Long-tailed Medical Visual Question Answering
papers.venue: Conference and Labs of the Evaluation Forum
papers.authors: Sedigheh Eslami,Gerard de Melo,C. Meinel
papers.summary: The proposed BBN-Orchestra is an ensemble of bilateral-branch networks (BBN) and successfully reduces overfitting to train and validation data in addition to effectively modeling the imbalanced long-tailed image distribution.

papers.title: Cross-Modal Self-Attention with Multi-Task Pre-Training for Medical Visual Question Answering
papers.authors: Haifan Gong,Guanqi Chen,Sishuo Liu,Yizhou Yu,Guanbin Li
papers.summary: This work reformulates image feature pre-training as a multi-task learning paradigm and witness its extraordinary superiority, forcing it to take into account the applicability of features for the specific image comprehension task.

papers.title: Medical Visual Question Answering: A Survey
papers.authors: Zhihong Lin,Donghao Zhang,Qingyi Tao,Danli Shi,Gholamreza Haffari,Qi Wu,M. He,Z. Ge
papers.summary: This research presents a novel and scalable approaches to integrate 3D image recognition and 3D speech recognition into the clinical practice of ophthalmology.

papers.title: Medical visual question answering based on question-type reasoning and semantic space constraint
papers.authors: Meiling Wang,Xiaohai He,Luping Liu,L. Qing,Honggang Chen,Yan Liu,Chao Ren
papers.summary: A novel Med-VQA framework is proposed to alleviate the above-mentioned problems, which employed a question-type reasoning module severally to closed-ended and open-ended questions, thereby extracting the important information contained in the questions through an attention mechanism and filtering the noise to extract more valuable question features.

papers.title: Medical visual question answering via corresponding feature fusion combined with semantic attention.
papers.authors: Han Zhu,Xiaohai He,Meiling Wang,Mozhi Zhang,L. Qing
papers.summary: A corresponding feature fusion (CFF) method to strengthen the interactions of specific features from corresponding radiology images and questions and a semantic attention (SA) module for textual feature extraction is proposed.

papers.title: Adversarial Learning to Improve Question Image Embedding in Medical Visual Question Answering
papers.authors: Kaveesha Silva,Thanuja Maheepala,Kasun Tharaka,Thanuja D. Ambegoda
papers.summary: A new method for training VQA models that utilizes adversarial learning to improve the question-image embedding and demonstrates how this embedding can be used as the ideal embedding for answer inference.

papers.title: Alternating Cross-attention Vision-Language Model for Efficient Learning with Medical Image and Report without Curation
papers.authors: Sangjoon Park,Eunha Lee,Jeonghyeon Lee,Jong-Chul Ye
papers.summary: It is experimentally demonstrated that the pre-trained MAX-VL model outperforms the current state-of-the-art vision language models in various vision-language tasks and suggested the clinical utility for the diagnosis of newly emerging diseases and human error detection as well as showed the widespread applicability of the model in different domain data.

papers.title: Vision-Language Pretraining Enables Radiographs and Reports to be Learned without Curation
papers.authors: Sangjoon Park,Eunha Lee,Jeonghyeon Lee,Jong-Chul Ye
papers.summary: It is experimentally demonstrated that the pre-trained medical X-VL model outperforms the current state-of-the-art models in various vision-language tasks in medical domains, which suggests the potential of the model for widespread applicability in different medical applications.
